$regime.title: Tax Regime
$regime.description:
Regime is the country code that identifies the tax regime applicable to the document.
It determines which country-specific tax rules, normalizations, and validations are applied.
If this field is not provided, the supplierâ€™s country code is used as the default regime.

$addons.title: Addons
$addons.description:
Addons defines a list of keys used to identify tax addons that apply special
normalization, scenarios, and validation rules to a document.

$tags.title: Tags
$tags.description:
Tags are used to help identify specific tax scenarios or requirements that may
apply changes to the contents of the document or imply a specific meaning.
Converters may use tags to help identify specific situations that do not have
a specific extension, for example; self-billed or partial invoices may be
identified by their respective tags.

oneOf.title: Standard
oneOf.description: A regular commercial invoice document between a supplier and customer.

oneOf.title: Proforma
oneOf.description: For a clients validation before sending a final invoice.

oneOf.title: Corrective
oneOf.description: Corrected invoice that completely *replaces* the preceding document.

oneOf.title: Credit Note
oneOf.description:
Reflects a refund either partial or complete of the preceding document. A 
credit note effectively *extends* the previous document.

oneOf.title: Debit Note
oneOf.description: An additional set of charges to be added to the preceding document.

oneOf.title: Other
oneOf.description:
Any other type of invoice that does not fit into the standard categories and implies
that any scenarios defined in tax regimes or addons will not be applied.

This is useful for being able to create invoices with custom types in extensions,
but is not recommend for general use.

type.title: Type
type.description: Type of invoice document. May be restricted by local tax regime requirements.

series.title: Series
series.description:
Series is used to identify groups of invoices by date, business area, project,
type of document, customer type, a combination of any or other company specific data.
If the output format does not support the series as a separate field, it will be
prepended to the code for presentation with a dash (`-`) for separation.

code.title: Code
code.description:
Code is a sequential identifier that uniquely identifies the invoice. The code can
be left empty initially, but is **required** to **sign** the invoice.

issue_date.title: Issue Date
issue_date.description:
Issue date for when the invoice was created and issued. Todays date is used if
none is set. There are often legal restrictions on how far back or in the future an
invoice can be issued.

issue_time.title: Issue Time
issue_time.description:
IssueTime is an optional field that may be useful to indicate the time of day when
the invoice was issued. Some regions and formats may require this field to be set.
An empty string will be automatically updated to reflect the current time, otherwise
the field can be left with a nil value.

op_date.title: Operation Date
op_date.description: Date when the operation defined by the invoice became effective.

value_date.title: Value Date
value_date.description: When the taxes of this invoice become accountable, if none set, the issue date is used.

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: Currency for all invoice amounts and totals, unless explicitly stated otherwise.

exchange_rates.title: Exchange Rates
exchange_rates.description: Exchange rates to be used when converting the invoices monetary values into other currencies.

preceding.title: Preceding Details
preceding.description: Document references for previous invoices that this document replaces or extends.

supplier.title: Supplier
supplier.description: The entity supplying the goods or services and usually responsible for paying taxes.

customer.title: Customer
customer.description:
Legal entity receiving the goods or services, may be nil in certain circumstances
such as simplified invoices.

lines.title: Lines
lines.description: List of invoice lines representing each of the items sold to the customer.

discounts.title: Discounts
discounts.description: Discounts or allowances applied to the complete invoice

charges.title: Charges
charges.description: Charges or surcharges applied to the complete invoice

ordering.title: Ordering Details
ordering.description: Ordering details including document references and buyer or seller parties.

payment.title: Payment Details
payment.description: Information on when, how, and to whom the invoice should be paid.

delivery.title: Delivery Details
delivery.description: Specific details on delivery of the goods referenced in the invoice.

totals.title: Totals
totals.description: Summary of all the invoice totals, including taxes (calculated).

notes.title: Notes
notes.description:
Unstructured information that is relevant to the invoice, such as correction or additional
legal details.

complements.title: Complements
complements.description: Additional complementary objects that add relevant information to the invoice.

meta.title: Meta
meta.description: Additional semi-structured data that doesn't fit into the body of the invoice.

attachments.title: Attachments
attachments.description:
Attachments provide additional information or supporting documents that are not included
in the main document. It is important that attachments are not used for alternative
versions of the PDF, for that, see "links" inside the envelope headers.

Invoice.description: Invoice represents a payment claim for goods or services supplied under conditions agreed between the supplier and the customer.
